description:
Come join Home Trust Company (Subsidiary of Fairstone Bank) as a Commercial Mortgage Specialist!
Home Trust Company has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender, employing nearly 800 people in our Toronto headquarters and branches across the country. Building on the demonstrated strength of its core residential mortgage lending business, the Company also offers complementary lending services, as well as highly competitive deposit investment products, through Oaken Financial. Our culture has been shaped by the passion and integrity of our people. Home Trust is a private company.
FIRST THING – WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?  

We are looking for individuals who are dedicated, passionate, and driven to execute with excellence!
ABOUT THE ROLE:
The Commercial Mortgage Specialist supports the Commercial Underwriting department by managing the creation and administration of commercial mortgage loans. The role ensures underwriting conditions are met, security documents are properly handled and acts as a liaison between internal teams and external partners. Key duties include loan origination assistance, managing letters of credit, resolving remittance issues, conducting monthly servicer follow\-ups, processing portfolio renewals and assumptions, posting fees, handling inquiries, and updating ownership records—all while maintaining accuracy, efficiency, and service standards.
In addition:* This involves collecting all necessary documents related to a transaction. These documents could include loan applications, credit reports, financial statements, identification documents, and any other relevant documentation required for the transaction.
* Ensure all documentation complies with regulatory requirements and internal policies.
* Collaborate with underwriting, funding and Portfolio Management teams, to ensure smooth and timely closing.
* Provide a high level of service and support to internal and external business partners.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with Internal and external commercial partners.
* Ensure all underwriting conditions are satisfied to advance the file to the next stage and facilitate timely loan funding.
* Manage and prioritize workload to achieve compliance with service level agreements (SLAs).
* Loan Origination: Facilitate the initiation of commercial mortgage loans by gathering required documentation and client information.
* Letters of Credit: Manage the issuance and reporting process for letters of credit.
* Remittances: Resolve discrepancies and oversee arrears management for remittances.
* Undertakings: Perform monthly follow\-ups with servicers and secure all necessary approvals.
* Portfolio Management: Process renewals and assumptions in strict compliance with established procedures.
* Fees: Accurately record and reconcile various fees, ensuring timely payment.
* Commercial Inquiries Inbox: Efficiently manage and respond to daily email inquiries.
* Relationship Management: Maintain and update records of beneficial ownership, directors, officers, trustees, and settlors for all business partners in accordance with onboarding protocols.


WHAT WE REQUIRE:* University degree in business, finance or related discipline
* Additional relevant accreditation(s), certification(s) are considered strong assets
* 1\-3 years experience working in an administrative/underwriting Commercial Mortgage Lending environment, from a recognized financial institution
* Loan Origination Systems: Moodys Credit Lens, SAP
* Software Proficiency: Microsoft 365 Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook), Microsoft Teams, One Drive, One Note, Power BI, Share Point
* Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy in documentation and compliance.
* Communication \& Negotiation: Clear interaction with external partners, underwriters, and internal teams.
* Organizational Skills: Managing multiple files and meeting strict deadlines.
* Problem\-Solving \& Critical Thinking: Addressing discrepancies and resolving issues efficiently.
* Customer Service Orientation: Maintaining strong client relationships and responsiveness.


PREREQUISITE: Maintain a positive supportive attitude, help to maintain an inclusive and supportive company culture!
Expected salary range is $55,000 to $65,000 per year.
This posting is for an existing vacancy within our organization.

* Post\-secondary degree or diploma, preferably in business management, finance, or related field (university an asset)

description:
Under the direction of the Manager, Loan Review (RESL), the primary purpose of the role is to complete independent, objective reviews of credit transactions against the Company’s credit risk policies and guidelines. The incumbent is responsible for the structured, objective and independent review of the Company’s credit transactions as selected by the Director, Loan Review or delegate.
Credit transactions include all Fairstone lending products including residential mortgage lending (RESL), direct lending (secured and unsecured), automotive, and credit cards. The incumbent is also responsible for making recommendations on training needs and modifications to lending guidelines and processes to reflect a best\-in\-class operation.
Risk Management \& Compliance, in adhering to applicable compliance obligations, including Privacy, Anti\-Money Laundering/Anti\-Terrorist Financing and internal Anti\-Fraud Policy requirements, must remain the over\-arching focus in carrying out one’s responsibilities as outlined below:
Loan File Review
The incumbent will be responsible for several different review types consistent with the team’s mandate and guidelines. Further details include:* Independently review assigned credit files to objectively evaluate:
	+ the quality of the credit decision
	+ adherence to the Company’s underwriting policies, guidelines and standards including insurer requirements
	+ the integrity of file documentation and data inputs
* Ensuring observations are accurate and defensible
* Ensuring results are accurately documented in the database. Ensure errors of omission are minimized.
* Responsibility for presenting and defending individual file review results in debriefs with the Underwriting VPs, Directors and Managers. Constructively evaluate underwriter’s responses and establishment of final file rating.
* Responsible for identifying and referring suspicious files to Corporate Compliance as appropriate to assist the Company in fulfilling its regulatory responsibilities
* Collaboratively support the preparation and issuance of reporting relating to the review results for EVPs and Credit Risk Committee
* Recommend changes to policy, standards, guidelines and operational procedures to promote consistency and effectiveness of decisions as needed
* Identifies systemic risks and opportunities to enhance underwriting standards to reflect sound practice


Other:* Proactively support ERM’s mandate including:
	+ identifying opportunities to improve the risk discipline in underwriting credit applications
	+ promote a strong risk culture within the Company
	+ identify and participate in related initiatives under the direction of the Director, Retail Loan Review


Qualification* University degree in business, economics, finance or related discipline or related business experience
* Additional relevant accreditation(s), certification(s) are strong assets
* 3\+ years underwriting experience
* Sound, practical knowledge of residential mortgage lending, particularly with Alt\-A products
* Sound practical knowledge of insured mortgage products
* Proficient with residential property appraisal reviews
* Knowledge of residential mortgage credit policies, standards and guidelines
* Strong interpersonal relationship building and listening skills
* Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment
* Excellent written / verbal communication and professional maturity
* Solution\-focused and takes initiative to work effectively and efficiently within established guidelines
* Strong organizational, time management, research/ analysis and attention to detail
* Able to multi\-task and flourish in a fast paced, deadline\-driven work environment
* Understands Home Trust Company’s lending criteria and culture
* Solid knowledge of MS Office


Expected salary range: $62,000 to $70,000 per year.

Home Trust Company has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender, employing nearly 800 people in our Toronto headquarters and branches across the country. Building on the demonstrated strength of its core residential mortgage lending business, the Company also offers complementary lending services, as well as highly competitive deposit investment products, through Oaken Financial. Our culture has been shaped by the passion and integrity of our people. Home Trust is a private company.  

FIRST THING – WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?  

We are looking for individuals who are dedicated, passionate, and driven to execute with excellence!  

WE CARE ABOUT OUR EMPLOYEES WELL\-BEING, WHAT WE OFFER:* Base salary, with yearly incentive performance bonus
* Three (3\) weeks of vacation, an additional six (6\) flex days (sick or personal) in addition to statutory holidays
* Comprehensive benefit packages
* Group Retirement Savings Plan (GRSP)
* Employee Discounts; phone plans, gym membership, Toronto Bike Share and many retailer discounts offered through WorkPerks
* Education Assistance program


ABOUT THE ROLE:
The Residential Underwriter will adjudicate mortgage applications by assessing prospective clients in accordance with the 5 C's (Capacity, Capital, Collateral, Character, and Conditions). Assessing risk and ensuring all applications adhere to both quality and service standards remain the overarching focus for this role.
 In addition:* Make prudent credit decisions on complex mortgage files
* Receive, review, analyze and verify mortgage applications for completeness, accuracy, suitability and risk to ensure compliance with all aspects of Home Trust Company’s underwriting policies, procedures and guidelines per delegated authority matrices
* Adhere to applicable compliance obligations including Privacy, Anti\-Money Laundering/Anti\-Terrorist Financing and internal Anti\-Fraud Policy requirements
* File Unusual Transaction Reports as applicable to fulfill individual employee obligations to detect and deter financial crimes activity. Maintain consistent, objective and sound risk assessments in a high volume, service\-oriented environment
* Analyze and underwrite residential mortgage applications, including an assessment of the borrower, real estate security and loan terms as well as identifying any associated risk
* Negotiate, recommend and approve loan terms within Home Trust’s risk appetite
* Maintain accurate information and detailed notes on applications
* Prepare and issue conditional mortgage commitments according to negotiated and approved terms, which outline all conditions that must be met to Home Trust’s satisfaction


WHAT WE REQUIRE:* Authorized to work in Canada
* Great communication skills
* Post\-secondary degree or diploma, preferably in business management, finance, or related field (university an asset)
* 3\-5 years mortgage lending experience

We are currently seeking a Director, Treasury Operations to join our dynamic and collaborative Treasury team. Reporting to the Treasurer, the candidate will be responsible for managing our cash management banking relationships, our treasury operations and our short\-term liquidity. The role will involve leading and coordinating multiple cash management service implementation projects involving numerous departments within the bank. He/She will supervise a Manager, Senior Analyst and run our internship program. This is an excellent opportunity for a collaborative leader with strong organizational, communication, and analytical skills to drive value and make a meaningful impact within our growing organization.
Description:* Manage and optimize cash management and treasury operations activities, including administration of bank accounts and related services for all Fairstone Group legal entities.
* Develop and implement a bank account management strategy
* Negotiate bank fees and cash management service contracts for Fairstone Group.
* Manage, monitor, and forecast short\-term liquidity requirements, provide visibility through daily liquidity management reporting, and ensure the bank meets its liquidity regulatory requirements.
* Oversee diligent timely execution of all key treasury payments (financing, investment, derivative, collateral, bank account funding), intercompany transactions, and key corporation payments.
* Lead cash management projects and act as subject matter expert in the implementation of new services and banking/payment technology, new legal entities and new branches, and champion process improvement with a lean approach.
* Develop and foster strong relationships with our cash management banks and with internal parties (account payable, legal, accounting, IT, branch operations, etc)
* Recommend borrowing and investments decisions based on forecasted liquidity to the Liquidity Management team and Funding Management team.
* Foster a culture and environment of compliance and controls and ensure treasury activities are in compliance with treasury policies, regulatory requirements, accounting guidelines, governance policies and internal controls through diligent monitoring.
* Provide support for internal controls and audit activities.
* Act as a champion for our treasury management system solutions and support upgrades of our ERP system Workday
* Develop a solid understanding of our operations and systems, maintain up\-to\-date knowledge on industry trends and share knowledge and best practices with team


Qualifications:* A minimum of 10 years’ experience in treasury management and 5 years in employee management. Experience in financial services or retail industry considered an asset.
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics
* Professional designation (CFA, CTP, or CPA) is an asset
* You are recognized for being a positive team leader with excellent communication skills (verbal and written, English and French – an asset), who shows passion for quality products and processes
* You have excellent organizational skills, you are autonomous, able to manage multiple deliverables and meet deadlines
* You demonstrate initiative, accountability, data integrity with strong attention to details
* You demonstrate problem\-resolution skills, ability to work in a dynamic fast\-paced environment and to adapt quickly to changing priorities
* You have strong computer skills: Advanced Excel (VBA, PowerBI, Macro is desired), Word, Access, PowerPoint, Bloomberg, Workday

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un Directeur, Opérations de trésorerie, pour se joindre à notre équipe de trésorerie dynamique et collaborative. Relevant du Trésorier, la personne choisie sera responsable de la gestion de nos relations bancaires en matière de gestion de trésorerie, de l’administration bancaire, des opérations de trésorerie ainsi que de nos liquidités à court terme. Elle s’occupera notamment de la coordination et implantation de multiples projets de nouveaux services (gestion de l’encaisse) impliquant plusieurs départements de la Banque et partenaires externes. Elle supervisera un gestionnaire, un analyste principal, et dirigera notre programme de stage en trésorerie. Il s’agit d’une excellente occasion pour un leader collaboratif doté de solides compétences organisationnelles, communicationnelles et analytiques, afin de créer de la valeur et d’avoir un impact significatif au sein de notre organisation en pleine croissance.  

Description :* Gérer et optimiser les activités de gestion de l’encaisse et les opérations de trésorerie, notamment par l’administration des comptes bancaires et les services connexes pour toutes les entités juridiques du Groupe Fairstone.
* Élaborer et mettre en œuvre une stratégie de gestion des comptes bancaires.
* Négocier les frais bancaires et les contrats de services de gestion de trésorerie pour le Groupe Fairstone.
* Gérer, surveiller et prévoir les besoins de liquidité à court terme, assurer la visibilité au moyen de rapports quotidiens sur la gestion de la liquidité et veiller à ce que la Banque respecte ses obligations réglementaires en matière de liquidité.
* Superviser l’exécution diligente et en temps opportun de tous les paiements de trésorerie clés (financement, investissement, produits dérivés, garanties, financement de comptes bancaires), des opérations interentreprises et des paiements clés de l’entreprise.
* Diriger des projets de gestion de trésorerie et agir à titre d’expert en la matière dans la mise en œuvre de nouveaux services, de nouvelles technologies bancaires et de paiement, de nouvelles entités juridiques et de nouvelles succursales, et promouvoir l’amélioration des processus au moyen d’une approche allégée.
* Développer de solides relations avec nos partenaires bancaires en gestion de trésorerie et internes (au sein des services des Comptes fournisseurs, des Affaires juridiques, de Comptabilité, des TI et des Opérations des succursales, etc.).
* Recommander des décisions d’emprunt et d’investissement en fonction des prévisions de liquidités à l’équipe de gestion de la liquidité et à l’équipe de gestion du financement.
* Favoriser une culture et un environnement de conformité et de contrôle et veiller à ce que les activités de trésorerie soient conformes aux politiques de trésorerie, aux exigences réglementaires, aux directives comptables, aux politiques de gouvernance et aux contrôles internes au moyen d’une surveillance diligente.
* Soutenir les activités de contrôle et d’audit internes.
* Agir en tant que champion pour nos solutions du système de gestion de la trésorerie et coordonner les mises à niveau de notre système de gestion intégrée Workday.
* Acquérir une solide compréhension de nos opérations et de nos systèmes, maintenir des connaissances à jour sur les tendances de l’industrie et partager les connaissances et les meilleures pratiques à l’équipe.


Compétences :* Minimum de dix ans d’expérience en gestion de trésorerie et cinq ans d’expérience en gestion d’employés. Expérience en services financiers ou au sein de l’industrie du détail considérée comme un atout.
* Baccalauréat en finance, en comptabilité ou en économie.
* Titre professionnel (analyste financier agréé, professionnel agréé en trésorerie ou comptable professionnel agréé), un atout.
* Vous êtes reconnu comme un chef d’équipe positif qui possède d’excellentes aptitudes en communication (verbale et écrite, anglais et français – un atout) et qui fait preuve de passion envers les produits et processus de qualité.
* Vous détenez d’excellentes compétences organisationnelles. Vous êtes autonome et capable de gérer plusieurs livrables concurrents et de respecter les échéances.
* Vous faites preuve d’initiative, de responsabilité et d’intégrité des données, avec un grand souci du détail.
* Vous faites preuve de compétences en résolution de problèmes et vous êtes capable à travailler dans un environnement dynamique et à vous adapter rapidement aux changements de priorités.
* Vous possédez de solides compétences en informatique : connaissances approfondies d’Excel (VBA, PowerBI et macros souhaités), de Word, d’Access, de PowerPoint, de Bloomberg et de Workday.


Échelle salariale: 135 000$ \- 160 000$ par année

description:
QUI NOUS SOMMES  

Fairstone Financière est un chef de file canadien en solutions de prêt responsables. Nous offrons des prêts personnels et du financement au point de vente, aidant les particuliers et les entreprises à atteindre leurs objectifs financiers grâce à des options flexibles et accessibles.
Nous ne faisons pas que prêter de l’argent — nous offrons des solutions personnalisées. Nos conseiller.ères en prêts sont des expert.es de confiance qui assurent un service exceptionnel tout en atteignant et dépassant leurs objectifs de vente.
VOTRE RÔLE
En tant que Conseiller.ère en prêts, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la croissance de notre entreprise en :* Promouvant et vendant activement nos produits de prêt et de protection dans un environnement dynamique et axé sur les ventes
* Comprenant les besoins des clients afin de leur recommander les meilleures solutions financières
* Gérant l’ensemble du processus de vente, en personne ou à distance — de la demande à la conclusion
* Établissant des relations solides et durables basées sur la confiance
* Demeurant concentré.e sur les objectifs de vente individuels et d’équipe
* Effectuant l’analyse de crédit, la gestion des paiements et le suivi des comptes en souffrance


POURQUOI VOUS JOINDRE À NOUS?
Parce que nous vous offrons bien plus qu’un emploi — nous vous offrons une carrière enrichissante et rémunératrice :* Salaire de base compétitif \+ primes de rendement illimitées
* 15 jours de vacances minimum, congés bien\-être et jours fériés
* Régime d’avantages sociaux complet, incluant la télémédecine
* Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur et programme de contrepartie
* Formation continue et développement professionnel
* Programme de récompenses, primes de référencement et rabais employés
* Culture d’équipe positive et collaborative qui valorise la performance et l’engagement


CE QUE VOUS APPORTEREZ* Diplôme d’études secondaires requis (des études postsecondaires en finance, ventes ou administration sont un atout)
* Minimum d’un (1\) an d’expérience en ventes, avec une orientation résultats
* Excellentes compétences en communication, négociation et service à la clientèle
* Attitude positive, esprit d’équipe et goût du défi

WHO WE ARE  

Fairstone Financial is a leading Canadian provider of responsible lending solutions. We offer personal loans and retail financing at the point of sale, helping individuals and businesses meet their financial goals with flexible, accessible options.
We’re not just in the lending business — we’re in the business of finding solutions. Our Loan Consultants are trusted advisors who deliver exceptional service while consistently exceeding sales targets.
YOUR ROLE  

As a Loan Consultant, you’ll play a key part in growing our business by:* Actively promoting and selling loan and protection products in a fast\-paced, sales\-driven environment
* Understanding customer needs to recommend the right financial solutions
* Managing the entire sales process, both in person and virtually — from application to closing
* Building strong relationships and earning trust through excellent service
* Staying focused on individual and team sales goals
* Performing credit assessments, processing payments, and managing overdue accounts


WHAT YOU BRING* High school diploma (post\-secondary education in finance, sales, or business is an asset)
* Minimum 1 year of sales experience with a focus on meeting/exceeding targets
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills
* A customer\-first mindset and a passion for delivering value

Le candidat choisi devra aussi diriger de façon proactive diverses activités, telles que la gestion des calendriers, l’organisation et la planification de réunions ainsi que la coordination de déplacements. Au besoin, il aidera à préparer des présentations et l’ordre du jour de réunions.
Le titulaire devra agir comme agent de liaison/partenaire clé pour les cadres et les employés; il devra être proactif, autonome et capable de préparer des documents de réunion avec un minimum de supervision. Le candidat doit posséder d’excellentes compétences en communication en français et en anglais, et doit faire preuve de débrouillardise dans un environnement qui évolue rapidement.

About Us:
It’s an exciting time at Fairstone Bank and here is a fantastic opportunity to join the Marketing organization as a Senior Marketing Manager, Acquisition (Direct Lending).
At Fairstone we’re a customer\-obsessed financial services company redefining how Canadians access and experience lending. Our culture is built on doing what’s right and working together to get things done. We believe in empowering our people to challenge the status quo and deliver marketing that drives real business and customer impact.
About the Role
We are seeking a strategic and results\-driven Senior Marketing Manager to lead acquisition programs for our Direct Lending business. Reporting to the Director, Marketing (Direct Lending), this role is pivotal in driving customer growth through high\-performing channels, optimizing marketing investments, and delivering actionable insights that shape business decisions. You will be responsible for transforming our Direct Mail and Affiliate channels, owning acquisition measurement, and leading cross\-functional optimization efforts.
Key Responsibilities
Channel Leadership \& Transformation* Direct Mail Program: Lead the transformation of our Direct Mail strategy, including right\-sizing the channel, streamlining production processes, and driving cost efficiencies while maintaining performance.
* Affiliate Acquisition: Manage and grow the Affiliate channel by partnering with external organizations to generate high\-quality leads. Optimize cost\-per\-acquisition and scale performance through strategic collaboration.


Acquisition Measurement \& Insights* Own the end\-to\-end acquisition measurement framework across all channels (inclusive of the channels owned by others that support Direct Lending programs).
* Develop and deliver timely, actionable insights that highlight business health, trends, and opportunities.
* Create urgency and alignment across teams through clear communication of performance metrics, leading ongoing Performance forums/conversations with key stakeholders.


Optimization \& Performance Management* Lead real\-time optimization sessions with key stakeholders to reallocate investments and maximize ROI across channels.
* Drive a test\-and\-learn culture, identifying opportunities for experimentation and scaling successful initiatives.


Cross\-Functional Collaboration* Work closely with Digital Marketing to collaborate on the delivery of a total Acquisition channel view.
* Partner with the Direct Lending Product Team to align on offers, promotions, and testing strategies.
* Collaborate with Analytics to operationalize reporting, diagnostics, and performance tracking tools. Co\-lead the Attribution framework with Analytics, ensuring the continued evolution of this important tool is reflective of the evolving mix and consumer behaviour.
* Work closely with Finance to manage the Acquisition Budget and Forecasting, and Pro Forma frameworks, ensuring accuracy and accountability

What you bring:* 7\+ years of progressive experience in performance marketing, preferably in financial services or lending.
* Proven success in managing direct mail and/or affiliate marketing programs.
* Strong analytical mindset with experience in marketing measurement, attribution, and optimization.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross\-functional teams and influence senior stakeholders.
* Experience with budget management and forecasting.
* Excellent communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to translate data into strategic insights.
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field; MBA is a plus.


Why join us:* A culture that values creativity, agility, and bold ideas, putting the customer at the centre of everything we do.
* A company with a nearly 100\-year legacy in Canada
* Your work will be recognized with a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards Program
* Opportunities for career growth through numerous internal and external programs
* Be a part of your community. Opportunities for coordinated paid volunteer time to help the organizations you care about.
* Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues
* Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

* Comprenant les besoins des clients afin de leur recommander les meilleures solutions financières
* Gérant l’ensemble du processus de vente, en personne ou à distance — de la demande à la conclusion
* Établissant des relations solides et durables basées sur la confiance
* Demeurant concentré.e sur les objectifs de vente individuels et d’équipe
* Effectuant l’analyse de crédit, la gestion des paiements et le suivi des comptes en souffrance


POURQUOI VOUS JOINDRE À NOUS?
Parce que nous vous offrons bien plus qu’un emploi — nous vous offrons une carrière enrichissante et rémunératrice :* Salaire de base compétitif \+ primes de rendement illimitées
* 15 jours de vacances minimum, congés bien\-être et jours fériés
* Régime d’avantages sociaux complet, incluant la télémédecine
* Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur et programme de contrepartie
* Formation continue et développement professionnel
* Programme de récompenses, primes de référencement et rabais employés
* Culture d’équipe positive et collaborative qui valorise la performance et l’engagement


CE QUE VOUS APPORTEREZ* Diplôme d’études secondaires requis (des études postsecondaires en finance, ventes ou administration sont un atout)
* Minimum d’un (1\) an d’expérience en ventes, avec une orientation résultats
* Excellentes compétences en communication, négociation et service à la clientèle
* Attitude positive, esprit d’équipe et goût du défi
* Vous devez être capable de communiquer en français et en anglais avec nos clients dans tout le Canada (40% en français et 60% en anglais).

description:
At Fairstone, our culture is built on strong values and leadership principles that define the expectations we have for working together and with our customers. We help Canadians find the right solution to meet their needs with a variety of products and services. Our values and principles guide the actions we take to ensure our customers get the best experience possible.
Be part of our talented and growing team! We are currently looking for a Manager, Strategic Sourcing, to join our team reporting to the Director, Strategic Sourcing and Vendor Management.
As a Manager, Strategic Sourcing, you will be responsible for overseeing procurement activities and the application of procurement policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. You will be accountable for performing analyses and making strategic recommendations concerning all contracts as well as provide internal customers with recommended assistance in supplier management, will create and maintain various reports (key performance indicators, catalogue of products and services, dashboards, etc.)
"Be a part of our inclusive workplace where diverse perspectives drive innovation and excellence."
WHY JOIN US?
BECAUSE WE ARE PROUD TO BE One of Montreal's Top Employers for 2025 for the fifth consecutive year by the editors of *Canada's Top 100 Employers*.
WE OFFER:* Work\-Life Balance: Our 37\.5\-hour workweek and hybrid model (3 days in\-office) promote a healthy balance.
* Wellness: Tailored well\-being solutions available 24/7\.
* Time Off: Minimum 15 paid vacations, 6 wellness days, with federal holidays.
* Community Support: Paid Volunteer Day to give back to your community.
* Retirement Planning: Employee and employer contribution pension plan, plus the Fairstone Retirement Savings Plan
* Development: Access to Fairstone Academy for comprehensive training and skill development.
* Employee discounts: Exclusive access to discounted products and services, including car insurance, hotels, attractions, movies, gym memberships, and more.


WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?* Ownership of the assigned engagement, including but not limited to establishing / managing/ negotiating/leading executing contractual agreements, vendor onboarding \& due diligence process throughout the vendor lifecycle.
* Lead end\-to\-end sourcing activities for assigned categories, including RFPs, vendor selection, and contract negotiations.
* Draft, review, and manage complex contracts, ensuring alignment with other areas such as legal, IT, and risk.
* Conduct spend analysis and identify cost\-saving opportunities.
* Conduct analyses of existing vendor base to assess capability of meeting business objectives; balancing vendor concentration risks with vendor consolidation strategies.
* Maintain supplier master data and oversee contract lifecycle management
* Recommend/Develop and implement processes and tools for different types of contracts, risk assessments, disputes, and issue resolutions.
* Provide subject matter expertise and guidance to internal stakeholders on sourcing best practices.
* Supervise management and administration for a wide variety of contracts.
* Advise on the practices and considerations for upgrading existing contracts and solving complex contract management problems.
* Support accountable executives in the vendor performance management and evaluate operational issues and considerations in contract enforcement.
* Deliver on Strategic Sourcing Strategy, increase Strategic Sourcing brand awareness.
* Leading major contract negotiations, strategic sourcing activities, cross functional projects, risk and relationship management, and savings initiatives.
* Implement sound financial planning that is aligned with the corporate plan.
* Contribute to development \& continues improvement of policies, guidelines \& tools.
* Spearheading best practices for sourcing of new waves of technology and initiating strategies to boost suppliers’ technology innovation.
* Applying expert skills in data analytics, market research, sourcing, relationship and contract management.
* Manage vendor onboarding, due diligence, performance evaluations and relationships.
* Ensure the success and oversee the effectiveness of the vendor management program across the Bank by implementing common standards and practices.
* Design and implement supplier performance scorecards for vendor assessment in contract management, financial management, performance management, risk management and relationship management areas.
* Collaborate with business units to ensure vendor performance aligns with service level agreements and business expectations.
* Lead cross functional teams by effectively manage relationships with 1st and 2nd line business partners involved in management and oversight of service providers.
* Support development and implementation of relevant policies, standards, directives, frameworks, and requirements relating to management of third parties.
* Conduct contract reviews and due diligence activities to ensure contracts and renewals incorporate business and regulatory requirements.
* Ensure that third\-party risks are appropriately identified, assessed, managed, monitored and reported.
* Develop detailed expense models, budget forecasting and analysis.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR* University degree
* Minimum 5 years in a sourcing, contracts and vendor management role with a solid understanding of the entire vendor lifecycle.
* Experience ideally gained with a Bank or Financial Institution.
* Demonstrated experience successfully managing third parties, reviewing policies, performance, and contract management or negotiation strategy for small, medium and complex contracts
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements (OSFI) is an asset
* Business Process Optimization mindset – knowledge of processes for creating, analyzing, monitoring or improving requisitions
* Ability to communicate and work effectively cross\-functionally with internal stakeholders, as well as external stakeholders including vendors
* Mutli\-tasking and time\-management skills, with ability to prioritize tasks
* Must have proficient oral and written skills; including report writing and presentation skills
* Solid expertise using Microsoft Office, Power BI, Visio, SharePoint. Familiarity with eSourcing tools, is an asset

*Expected salary range is $65 000 to $97 000 per year.**This posting is for an existing vacancy within our* *organization.**Artificial intelligence may be used in parts of the recruitment process.*
